title: Humbert announces end of collaboration with coach Chardy
description: Ugo Humbert announced on Tuesday the end of his collaboration with Jeremy Chardy. “End of our beautiful adventure with Jeremy. Thank you for these two magnificent seasons at your side, all the incredible emotions, the precious moments past and all that you taught me,” Humbert wrote on Instagram. “I had a great time by your side. I will always be grateful. I wish you all the best for your new project.”         View this post on Instagram                       A post shared by Ugo Humbert (@ugohumbert) Last year Humbert climbed to a career-high No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings and won titles in Marseille and Dubai. The lefty reached his first ATP Masters 1000 final at the Rolex Paris Masters. Humbert reached the fourth round of the Australian Open, where he lost to second seed Alexander Zverev in four sets. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Ugo Humbert announced on Tuesday the end of his collaboration with Jeremy Chardy, who helped him to a career-high No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings.

By ATP Staff Ugo Humbert announced on Tuesday the end of his collaboration with Jeremy Chardy. “End of our beautiful adventure with Jeremy. html:
Player News

Humbert announces end of collaboration with coach Chardy

Humbert thanks countryman for 'beautiful adventure'

January 22, 2025

Mike Lawrence/ATP Tour

Jeremy Chardy helped Ugo Humbert reach a career-high No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings. By ATP Staff

Ugo Humbert announced on Tuesday the end of his collaboration with Jeremy Chardy.

“End of our beautiful adventure with Jeremy. Thank you for these two magnificent seasons at your side, all the incredible emotions, the precious moments past and all that you taught me,” Humbert wrote on Instagram.

“I had a great time by your side. I will always be grateful. I wish you all the best for your new project.”

Last year Humbert climbed to a career-high No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings and won titles in Marseille and Dubai. The lefty reached his first ATP Masters 1000 final at the Rolex Paris Masters.

Humbert reached the fourth round of the Australian Open, where he lost to second seed Alexander Zverev in four sets.
